title: Mummy blogger Constance Hall: ‘I’m in the cool kid’s club, everyone hates me’ | Daily Telegraph
text:
The advice every mum needs to read Perth blogger, Queen Constance Hall, reigns supreme She’s frank, explicit and sometimes even crude, but regardless of what you think of her, Constance Hall and her no-filter approach, is a woman on a mission to empower the masses.
The controversial mummy blogger and best-selling author shot to international fame in less than two years, with over a million Facebook followers and 150,000 copies of her book Like A Queen sold in under a year following a blog she wrote on parenting and sex which blew up at the end of 2015.
Speaking to Confidential the 33-year-old mother of four and wife to Bill Mahon, says she often has moments where her success doesn’t feel real after making a name for herself by sharing nudie pictures of her ‘mum bod,’ candid conversations about vaginas, and intimate details of her turbulent marriage and life as a busy mum, with hundreds of thousands of people around the globe.
“I feel like I’m in a dream still. I get emails of starkas women all the time and Bill thinks I’m a creep because I go through them and I’m like ‘Oh my god they’re so gorgeous’,” the Perth-based internet sensation says of her role in the body confidence movement.
“What’s wrong with having a wobbly stomach? I was fed up not being confident. Whether you’re comfortable with it or not I think it’s important to get it out there. I want our kids to see it; I want my sons to see normal figures.”
media_camera Constance Hall is a woman on a mission to empower the masses. Picture: Patrick Schuttler
However the fast-talking, self-titled Queen has learnt that not everyone shares her views. Assertive, extravert and somewhat confrontational, Hall is also deeply sensitive and suffers from anxiety due to constant trolling.
“Is it a tall poppy thing?” she asks inquisitively, as she tries to work out why people can be so cruel.
“In the beginning it was kind of cool to like me and then so many people liked me that it became cool not to like me. I’ve got a few coping mechanisms but if anyone could ever tell me how to take on board the positive and expel the negative I’d give them a million bucks – I’d give them my firstborn kid!”
Haters gonna hate
